result.execSummary:
The defendant Saveles Lavon Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentenced defendant to a total of 5 years WSP; 2 years initial term of incarceration; 3 years of extended supervision.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessments; comply with recommended treatment.

Serve condition time of 6 months in the HOC, huber for work, school, and treatment.  Last 4 months release to Day Reporting Center.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- IF REVOKED, Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years
years, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2  years with credit for 3 days 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
 The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 30 months  with the following conditions:
*Serve condition time of 6 months in the HOC, huber for work, school, and treatment.  Last 4 months release to Day Reporting Center.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample  if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- IF REVOKED, Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COUNT 2:   The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years
years, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2  years with credit for 3 days 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
 The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of
 30 months  with the following conditions:
*
Serve condition time of 6 months in the HOC, huber for work, school, and treatment.  Last 4 months release to Day Reporting Center.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample  if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- IF REVOKED, Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin for ADA Chojnacki.  As to COUNTS  1 and 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton and attorney Christopher Hartley on behalf of attorney Mark Pecora.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Pecora for attorney Houghton.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in court with attorney Gabriel Houghton.  William M. Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in court with attorney Gabriel Houghton.  Hanna Kolberg for William M. Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/17/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Saveles Lavon Smith in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
